required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lung Lavage With Dilute Poractant Alfa for Meconium Aspiration Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity Teaching Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Meconium aspiration syndrome (MAS) is an important cause of severe respiratory failure in newborn infants. Treatment for MAS is mainly supportive but surfactant therapy might change the course of the disease. Aim of the study to evaluate whether lung lavage with dilute or bolus poractant alfa changes the duration of mechanical respiratory support or other outcomes in MAS.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Total duration of mechanical ventilation, mode and ventilator parameters are noted till the baby is on mechanical ventilation.

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of Persistent Pulmonary Hypertension by Echocardiography and Pneumothorax by transillumination confirmed by chest x-ray.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 weeks or till discharge
secondary_outcome.description: We will record length of stay in a level III neonatal intensive care unit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 months or till discharge
secondary_outcome.description: We will record who died until discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants with a gestational age ≥ 36 weeks, birth weight ≥ 2.0 kg, evidence of passage of meconium at or before delivery, typical chest radiology findings and mechanically ventilated infants with a mean airway pressure ≥ 12 cm H2O were enrolled.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Congenital cardiac anomalies
- Major congenital anomalies
- Hemodynamically unstable infants

facility.name: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity Teaching Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital
